question.summary: Find SAGE Tags that are differentially expressed across 2 or more libraries.
Find DGE Tags that are differentially expressed across 2 or more libraries.
question.description:
Find SAGE Tags with evidence of differential expression by choosing libraries (more than one) to compare across. A large R value indicates differential expression. Stekel DJ, Git Y, Falciani F. The comparison of gene expression from multiple cDNA libraries. Genome Res. 2000. Dec:10(12):2055-61.

See the related Genes by Differential Expression of SAGE Tag Evidence query for summing SAGE tag counts within predicted genes.

See the related Genes by Differential Expression of SAGE Tag Evidence query for summing SAGE tag counts within predicted genes.

The data available here is from a study conducted by Radke et. al. where SAGE tag libraries were generated from T. gondii parasites at specific stages of development. The data available through ToxoDB includes 3' (3p) SAGE tag libraries only. Abbreviations are as follows:
sp   = Oocyst population that contains sporozoites (VEG strain).
d4   = Day 4 parasites (post-inoculation of human foreskin fibroblast cells (HFFs)).
d6   = Day 6 parasites (post-inoculation of HFFs) -- rapidly growing in the second host cell.
d7   = Day 7 parasites (post-inoculation of HFFs) -- parasites undergo a growth shift at this point.
d15 = Day 15 parasites (post-inoculation of HFFs) -- The parasites are slow growing and include a mixture of tachyzoites and bradyzoites.
ph   = VEG parasites that were alkaline-differentiated into bradyzoites for 72 hours.
rh    = TypeI-RH.
b7   = TypeII-ME49B7.
msj = TypeIII-VEGmsj.

question.name: SageTagByRadSourceId
question.description: Find DGE Tags By Identifier. The digital gene expression (DGE) tags represent a 21 bp tag usually from the first NlaIII restriction site upstream of the poly A tail on mRNA transcript. A detailed description of the method and experiment is available in Veitch et al ( Veitch NJ, Johnson PCD, Trivedi U, Terry S, Wildridge D and MacLeod A. Digital gene expression analysis of two life-cycle stages of the human-infective parasite, Trypanosoma brucei gambiense reveals differentially expressed clusters of co-regulated genes. BMC Genomics, 2010, 11:124-137). DGE tags were created from three procyclic-form and three bloodstream-form Trypanosoma brucei gambiense STIB386 in vitro cultures. The 21bp tags have been aligned to the T.b.brucei 927 and T.b.gambiense Dal genome databases, allowing for up to a 2 bp mismatch. The differential expression of bloodstream-form versus procyclic-form T.b.gambiense DGE tags is available to view for each tag. All tags were mapped to the genome. Tags that map to the forward strand are represented in Red. Tags that map to the reverse strand are represented in Blue. Tags that do not uniquely align to the genome (ie. map to more than one location) are represented in gray and on the negative axis.
